intro: Lacinaria scariosa var. multiplex, commonly known as the hairy lacinaria, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features distinctive, palmate leaves that are often covered in fine, hairy textures, contributing to its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its unique foliage and delicate floral display.
